title: Create AWS IAM resources for Crossplane
description: Create the permission boundary policy and crossplane-actuator IAM user per ADR-006. This is a manual prerequisite before Crossplane can manage AWS resources.

title: Create local actuator cluster
description: Provision a local Kubernetes cluster (kind) for running Crossplane.

title: Install Crossplane via Helm
description: Install Crossplane into the actuator cluster using Helm per ADR-006.

title: Install AWS Crossplane family providers
description: Install AWS family providers (s3, dynamodb, lambda, cloudwatchevents, iam) and configure ProviderConfig with crossplane-actuator credentials per ADR-006.

title: Install Kyverno
description: Install Kyverno policy engine into the actuator cluster per ADR-007.

title: Create Kyverno mutation policy for AWS resource tags
description: Create ClusterPolicy that automatically adds required tags (createdBy, managedBy, environment) to all AWS managed resources per ADR-007.

title: Create Kyverno validation policy for AWS resource tags
description: Create ClusterPolicy that rejects AWS managed resources missing required tags per ADR-007.

title: Create S3 bucket for static site and state
description: Provision an S3 bucket in us-east-1 for hosting static web assets, state.json, and Lambda artifacts.

title: Create DynamoDB table
description: Provision DynamoDB table using single-table design per ADR-004.

title: Create IAM roles and policies for Lambda
description: Define least-privilege IAM roles for Lambda functions. Roles must have MessageWallRoleBoundary attached per ADR-006.

title: Implement api-handler Lambda
description: Create Lambda that handles browser requests, updates DynamoDB, and emits EventBridge events.

title: Implement snapshot-writer Lambda
description: Create Lambda that generates state.json from DynamoDB and writes it to S3.

title: Package Lambda artifacts
description: Produce deterministic ZIP artifacts for both Lambdas.

title: Expose api-handler via Lambda Function URL
description: Create a Lambda Function URL to accept browser requests.

title: Create EventBridge rule for snapshot updates
description: Trigger snapshot-writer Lambda on api-handler events.

title: Create static HTML page
description: Create index.html for displaying message count and messages.

title: Implement browser-side JavaScript
description: Fetch state.json and POST messages to Lambda Function URL.

title: Design multi-tenant organization model for ConfigHub
description: Define how multiple teams, applications, or tenants would be organized within ConfigHub. Consider isolation, access control, and operational boundaries.
acceptance_criteria: Multi-tenant model documented. Isolation boundaries defined. Access control patterns outlined. Model validated against 2-3 hypothetical tenant scenarios.

title: Create deployment script
description: Script that applies all Crossplane resources for a dev environment.

title: Create smoke test
description: Script that posts a message and verifies DynamoDB and S3 state.

title: Create cleanup script
description: Script that tears down all managed resources.

title: Document bulk change scenarios
description: Describe how Lambda memory/timeouts could be changed across environments.

title: Document ConfigHub integration points
description: Identify where ConfigHub could manage and mutate resolved configuration.

title: Integrate ConfigHub as configuration control plane
Define ConfigHub spaces and units for the demo
description: Create ConfigHub spaces and initial units representing the serverless application infrastructure.

title: Render and publish Crossplane manifests to ConfigHub
description: Create CI pipeline step that renders fully-resolved Crossplane manifests and publishes to ConfigHub.

title: Attach policy checks to ConfigHub units
description: Define and apply policy checks (OPA or ConfigHub functions) to enforce basic guardrails.

title: Clarify and implement ConfigHub actuation mechanism
description: Determine how ConfigHub-approved manifests reach the Kubernetes actuator (ArgoCD push vs actuator pull) and implement the chosen approach.

title: Demonstrate bulk configuration change via ConfigHub
description: Use a ConfigHub function to update configuration across multiple resources in one operation.

title: Prevent CI from overwriting ConfigHub-managed changes
description: Establish ownership and concurrency rules to avoid clobbering ConfigHub-side edits.

title: Demonstrate break-glass recovery and reconciliation
description: Show how a direct AWS-side change can be reconciled back into ConfigHub after recovery.

title: Document ConfigHub + Crossplane demo narrative
description: Create a clear walkthrough explaining how ConfigHub, Crossplane, and AWS interact in the demo.

title: MERGE_REQUEST slit
description:
MR: me-817
Branch: polecat/slit-mkhlz3hc
Issue: serverless-message-wall-demo-izj
Source: POLECAT_DONE from messagewall/slit

title: Analyze ConfigHub spaces to Kubernetes namespaces mapping
description:
attached_args: Work through EPIC-19 sequentially: first 19.1 (this issue), then pick up 19.2 (serverless-message-wall-demo-5eg), then 19.3 (serverless-message-wall-demo-vbp). Complete each before moving to the next.
dispatched_by: mayor

Investigate whether there should be a 1:1 mapping between ConfigHub spaces and Kubernetes namespaces, or some other organizational model. Document the options and trade-offs.
acceptance_criteria: Options for space-to-namespace mapping documented. Trade-offs of each approach enumerated. Current demo setup analyzed against each option. Recommendation made with rationale.

title: Setup wizard for new users
close_reason: All child issues completed - setup wizard fully implemented

title: Write ADR-008 for setup wizard design
description: Document the design decisions for the setup wizard including interaction modes, validation strategy, template approach, and two-phase deployment for Function URL.

title: Integrate with bootstrap scripts
description: After configuration, offer to run the full bootstrap and deployment sequence.
close_reason: Added --deploy flag and interactive deployment offer to setup.sh

title: Create test suite for wizard
description: Write tests for the setup wizard covering validation, placeholder replacement, and error handling.

title: Write integration test for full setup flow
description: Create an end-to-end test that runs the wizard in non-interactive mode and verifies all placeholders are replaced correctly.
close_reason: Covered by test-setup.sh - template processing tests verify full setup flow

title: Update getting started documentation
description: Rewrite docs/setup-actuator-cluster.md and README.md to use the setup wizard as the primary onboarding path.
close_reason: Updated README.md and docs/setup-actuator-cluster.md to use wizard as primary onboarding path

title: Add prerequisite checker
description: Check that required tools are installed before running the wizard: aws cli, kubectl, kind, helm, docker.

title: Convert hardcoded values to placeholders
description: Replace all environment-specific hardcoded values with placeholder syntax. Affected files: IAM policies, Crossplane manifests, deploy scripts, Lambda defaults, index.html.

title: Create setup wizard with interactive mode
description: Create scripts/setup.sh that prompts users for required values: AWS account ID, resource prefix (for S3/DynamoDB naming), and AWS region.

title: Add non-interactive mode with CLI flags
description: Support --non-interactive mode with explicit flags: --account-id, --resource-prefix, --region. All values required in non-interactive mode.

title: Implement input validation
description: Validate user inputs before patching files. Check format only (no AWS API calls).
close_reason: Implemented as part of 9.3 - validates account ID (12 digits), region format, prefix rules, environment format

title: Implement re-run detection and warning
description: Detect if the wizard has already been run (placeholders already replaced) and warn the user before overwriting.
close_reason: Implemented as part of 9.3 - checks for .setup-state.json and prompts before overwriting

title: Add dry-run mode
description: Support --dry-run flag that shows what would change without modifying files.
close_reason: Implemented as part of 9.3 - supports --dry-run flag

title: Create AWS validation command
description: Create scripts/validate-aws.sh that checks AWS credentials, permissions, and resource availability.

title: Handle Function URL finalization
description: After infrastructure deployment, the Function URL is generated by AWS. Create a finalize step that retrieves the URL and updates index.html.

title: Implement bidirectional sync between Git and ConfigHub
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Per ADR-011, implement the three-way sync model where ConfigHub is authoritative and changes flow bidirectionally. Phase 1: ConfigHub → Git sync (visibility). Phase 2: Git → ConfigHub as proposal (conflict prevention). Phase 3: Live → ConfigHub capture (break-glass safety). Start with Phase 1 as it provides immediate value.
acceptance_criteria: ConfigHub changes trigger sync back to Git (Phase 1). CI cannot silently overwrite ConfigHub changes (Phase 2). Break-glass changes are captured, not lost (Phase 3). Conflict resolution process documented.
